definitions.definition: A built-in function that is implemented directly by the compiler, without any intermediate call to a library.
An ability possessed by a character and not requiring any external equipment.
definitions.example: You can acquire the fire-resistance intrinsic by eating dragon meat.

definitions.definition: Innate, inherent, inseparable from the thing itself, essential.
definitions.example: the intrinsic merit of an action

definitions.definition: (of a body part) Situated, produced, secreted in, or coming from inside an organ, tissue, muscle or member.
